intro: Gomphrena trispicata, commonly known as the three-bracted gomphrena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, spiky inflorescences. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red, often resembling a cluster of tiny bells. Gomphrena trispicata is typically found in dry, open habitats and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance. It is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
